file_header.SrcFileName_tip: Source file path; usually not needed, but should not be empty. The game mainly uses it in error logs (2.43.0). For non-Japanese versions, it attempts to match translations.
file_header.ItemName_tip: Item Name; not used, but should not be empty. The game reads and discards this value (2.43.0).
file_header.Category_tip: Item category; not used, but should not be empty. The game reads and discards this value (2.43.0). The value in the command segment will actually be used.
file_header.SetInfoText_tip: Item Description; usually not used, but should not be empty. But if the value is acctatoo or hokuro, the game deletes certain slot accessories (2.43.0).

commands.category: Specify the category to which this menu belongs. The parameter must be a value in the MPN enumeration
commands.priority: Specify the priority of the menu item. The larger the value, the lower it is in the ranking. It is a floating point number. Please do not set it below 0, because 0 is the remove menu
commands.name: Specifies the name of the menu item
commands.setumei: Specifies the description of the menu item, use „ÄäÊîπË°å„Äã for line breaks
commands.icons: Specifies the icon for the menu item, provide full filename like foo.tex, alias icon
commands.icon: Specifies the icon for the menu item, provide full filename like foo.tex, alias icons
commands.nodeÊ∂àÂéª: Used to hide a bone and its corresponding vertex group. Parameter 1 is the bone name keyword. Any bone with this keyword will be hidden, but category must be in m_strDefSlotName values
commands.color_set: Specifies a color for a category, parameter 1 is MPN enum, parameter 2 is the color.
commands.tex: Specifies a texture to change, parameter 1 is MPN enum, parameter 2 is texture ID, parameter 3 is texture file name (foo.mate), parameter 4 is unknown, parameter 5 is infinite color category. Alias: „ÉÜ„ÇØ„Çπ„ÉÅ„É£Â§âÊõ¥.
commands.„Éû„ÉÜ„É™„Ç¢„É´Â§âÊõ¥: Specifies a texture to change, parameter 1 is MPN enum, parameter 2 is texture ID, parameter 3 is texture file name (foo.mate), parameter 4 is unknown, parameter 5 is infinite color category. Alias: tex.
commands.„Ç¢„Ç§„ÉÜ„É†„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø: Sets additional parameters for an item slot (variable name, value), like specific attributes of items. Parameter 1 is MPN enum, parameter 2 is variable name, parameter 3 is value.
commands.additem: Adds a model to a specified category, parameters must be 2, 4, or 5, parameter 1 is MPN enum, parameter 2 is model file (foo.model), parameter 3 is attach, parameter 4 is attachment point MPN enum, parameter 5 is attachment point name.
commands.delitem: Removes a model from the specified category, parameter 1 is MPN enum.
commands.collabo: No parameters, marks this item as a collaborative item.
commands.„É°„Éã„É•„Éº„Éï„Ç©„É´„ÉÄ: This command specifies the menu folder path. If parameter 1 is 'man', it marks as male menu, keep clothing as DRESS (2.43.0).
commands.Â±ûÊÄßËøΩÂä†: Seems to have no effect, cannot find this value in the code (2.43.0).
commands.catno: Seems to have no effect, cannot find this value in the code, but for safety, set parameter to 0 (2.43.0).
commands.iconl: Seems to have no effect, the game checks if it‚Äôs not this value but does nothing (2.43.0).
commands.onclickmenu: Seems to have no effect, cannot find this value in the code, seems to be just a visual divider (2.43.0).
commands.Ê∂àÂéªnodeË®≠ÂÆöÈñãÂßã: Seems to have no effect, cannot find this value in the code, seems to be just a visual divider (2.43.0).
commands.Ê∂àÂéªnodeË®≠ÂÆöÁµÇ‰∫Ü: Seems to have no effect, cannot find this value in the code, seems to be just a visual divider (2.43.0).
commands.setstr: Seems to have no effect, the game checks if it‚Äôs not this value but does nothing (2.43.0).

snippet.pre_filled_tip: Pre-filled; multi-line insert with parameter placeholders
snippet.name: Item Name

MenuEditor.ctrl_space: Press Ctrl + Space for autocomplete options in Tree Indentation format
MenuEditor.other_shortcuts: For other shortcuts, refer to Monaco Editor's default shortcuts
MenuEditor.format_tree_tsv_use_tab: Use Tab key for tree indentation and TSV formats, not spaces.
MenuEditor.only_tree_indent_have_autocomplete: Autocomplete and hints are only available in Tree Indentation format.
MenuEditor.Args: Command and its parameters, first is command and next is command parameter
MenuEditor.place_mouse_on_command_view_description: Put the mouse over the command to see description
MenuEditor.cannot_save_empty_line: Cannot save empty lines, including lines with blank characters such as the tabs `Tab` key (\t), except in JSON format

file_header.Name: Name
file_header.Material_Name_tip: Material Name; the game assigns this to material.name and tries to find the same named .pmat file.
file_header.Material_ShaderName_tip: Shader Name; the game tries to find a shader with the same name.
file_header.Material_ShaderFilename_tip: Shader Filename; the game tries to find the shader file at a specific path.
file_header.Name_tip: Name for your reference; the game reads and discards this (2.43.0).

MateEditor.property_name_tip: Property Name; the game assigns this to the corresponding name (e.g., texture name, color name).
MateEditor.vec_tip: Vector (vec); similar to color but with RGBA replaced by XYZW. The game assigns this to the corresponding texture's color.
MateEditor.tex2dName_tip: 2D Texture Name; the game attempts to load a texture file with this name.
MateEditor.tex_offset_tip: Texture Offset; effective only in COM3D2.5+.
MateEditor.tex_scale_tip: Texture Scale; effective only in COM3D2.5+.
MateEditor.keyword_tip: Keyword; used to enable or disable shader features in COM3D2.5+.
MateEditor.col_tip: Color (col) Color value. The game will set the color of the corresponding texture name to this value. Note that the value range is 0-1 instead of 0-255 (2.43.0) Material.SetColor
MateEditor.f_tip: Float (f); the game assigns this float value to the corresponding texture name (2.43.0). Material.SetFloat
MateEditor.tex2dPath_tip: 2D Texture Path; not used, but should not be empty (2.43.0).
MateEditor.unknown_text_1_tip: Unknown Text 1; not used, the game just reads and discards (2.43.0) Presumably Render Texture
MateEditor.unknown_text_2_tip: Unknown Text 2; not used, the game just reads and discards (2.43.0) Presumably Render Texture

file_header.file_head: File Header (usually no need to modify)
file_header.Hash_tip: Hash; the game needs to calculate the hash for caching (2.43.0). Regardless of the value entered, it will be overwritten with the actual calculated value when saved. Unfortunately, different editors calculate hashes differently, so even if the values are the same, files saved by different editors will differ, resulting in incomplete cache utilization and possibly occupying a few extra KB of memory.

PMatEditor.materialName_tip: Material name; must be exactly the same as the material name in the .mate file header (2.43.0), and the editor will also use it for hash calculation.
PMatEditor.renderQueue_tip: Render Queue (RQ); the game will set this value to the corresponding render queue (2.43.0), the larger the value, the later the render. Typically, the GPU renders layer by layer, and later renders will overlap on top of previous renders. Default range: 0 - 5000.
PMatEditor.shaderName_tip: Shader Name; not used by the game, and the game doesn't even read this field (2.43.0), but the editor uses it for hash calculation to prevent the same material with different shaders from being cached, which would result in rendering order errors. Therefore, it's best to enter the correct shader name.

file_header.file_head: File Header (usually no need to modify)

ColEditor.ParentName_tip: Parent Node Name (ParentName); the parent node must be a valid Transform node, or it will throw an error 'No physical bone found.' A Transform node can be understood as a bone in modeling software.
ColEditor.SelfName_tip: The self node name of the collider (SelfName), it's best to prefix the name with _HIT_, as the official checker will prompt if it's not prefixed with _HIT_. If you don't know what name to choose, you can prefix it with _HIT_ using the parent node's name.
ColEditor.LocalPosition_tip: Local Position (LocalPosition); the position of the collider relative to the parent node.
ColEditor.LocalRotation_tip: Local Rotation (LocalRotation); the rotation of the collider relative to the parent node.
ColEditor.LocalScale_tip: Local Scale (LocalScale); the local scale of the collider relative to the parent node.
ColEditor.Direction_tip: Collider Direction (Direction); specify which axis is the height of the capsule collider, 0 for X axis, 1 for Y axis, 2 for Z axis, default is 1.
ColEditor.Center_tip: Local Center (Center); the center point of the collider's local coordinate system, default value is 0,0,0.
ColEditor.Radius_tip: Radius (Radius); the radius of the capsule collider, default value is 0.5.
ColEditor.Height_tip: Height (Height); the height of the capsule collider.
ColEditor.Bound_tip: Constraint Boundary (Bound); specify the collider's boundary constraint, 0 for Outside: prevents bones from entering the collider, 1 for Inside: forces bones to stay within the collider.
ColEditor.ScaleRateMulMax_tip: Max Scale Multiplier (ScaleRateMulMax); controls the maximum scale factor for the collider's radius, which works together with the BlendValue of the MuneL bone. When BlendValue=1.3, the maximum scaling multiplier is reached, and the final radius = base radius * (1 + scale multiplier limit * BlendValue/1.3f), default value is 1.
ColEditor.CenterRateMax_tip: Max Center Offset (CenterRateMax); defines the maximum offset of the center when deformation is at its maximum. It mixes with the base center point (Center) through linear interpolation, and the final center = Vector3.Lerp(center, max center offset, BlendValue/1.3f), default value is 0,0,0.
ColEditor.dbm_tip: When the character performs deep breathing or chest movement actions, adjusting these two parameters can achieve: the collider's radius increases as the chest expands (max scale multiplier), and the collider's center moves with the action (max center offset), thus maintaining consistency between physical collisions and visual models.

file_header.RootName_tip: Root Node Name (RootName); the name of the root Transform to apply physical effects. This field is not used by the game but is read and discarded, although it's not recommended to leave it empty to avoid possible reading errors (2.43.0).

PhyEditor.Damping_tip: Damping; Decay rate that controls the attenuation speed of bone movement. Higher values result in slower swinging (slower return to original position), lower values result in faster swinging (0=fastest decay, 1=slowest decay), default 0.5
PhyEditor.Elasticity_tip: Elasticity; Restoring force that resists positional changes. Controls how quickly bones return to their original positions. 1 means almost no movement (0=no resistance, 1=maximal resistance to displacement), default 0.1
PhyEditor.Stiffness_tip: Stiffness; Coefficient determining how well bones maintain their original orientation. Higher values make bones appear stiffer with less deformation (0=softest, 1=hardest), default 0.1
PhyEditor.Inert_tip: Inertia; Controls bone's responsiveness to character movement. Higher values reduce position changes during fast movement (0=full response, 1=partial ignore), default 0
PhyEditor.Radius_tip: Radius; Base collision detection range. Larger values increase collision detection area between bones and other objects, default 0
PhyEditor.EndLength_tip: End Bone Length; When non-zero, creates additional bones at the end of Transform hierarchy for physics simulation (can be understood as extra bones appended to the last bone segment). Default 0
PhyEditor.EndOffset_tip: End Bone Offset; Local coordinate offset for end bones. No end bones will be added if all values are 0, default 0,0,0
PhyEditor.Gravity_tip: Gravity; Force applied to bones that automatically eliminates internal stress from initial poses (positive values push, negative values pull on XYZ axes), default 0,0,0
PhyEditor.Force_tip: External Force; Continuous force applied to bones (positive values push, negative values pull on XYZ axes), default 0,-0.01,0
PhyEditor.ColliderFileName_tip: Collider File Name (ColliderFileName); Fill in the col file name to be applied, for example, foobar.col, but remove the .col suffix. It is recommended to have the same name as the phy file. If not filled in, the game will also try to read the `object name in the .model` + .col file
PhyEditor.ColliderCount_tip: Collider Count (ColliderCount); Fill in the number of colliders in the corresponding col file. Click the Auto Calculate button to automatically find the col file filled in the `Collider File Name` in the same folder as this file and calculate the number of colliders. This value is used to initialize the collider list.
PhyEditor.FreezeAxis_tip: Freeze Axis (FreezeAxis); freezes the bone's movement to only the specified axis. For example, if the X axis is frozen, the bone can only move in the Y Z plane. This has a lower priority than collision handling. Default value is 0.
PhyEditor.PartialMode_tip: Mode (PartialMode); 0 Static or Curve: uses the default value or curve, 1 By Bone Name: manually set values for each bone by name, 2 By old bone name, limited to _yure_hair_ and _skirt_ Automatically match the value by bone name. The bone name needs to contain the keyword _h_ or _h50_. Set different values ‚Äã‚Äãaccording to whether there is a keyword. If it is _skirt_, only _h_ can be used (old version, not recommended).
PhyEditor.default_value_tip: Default Value (DefaultValue); this value is used only when Mode 0 is selected and no keyframe is used.
PhyEditor.ExclusionsCount_tip: Exclusions Count (ExclusionsCount); seems to be the number of bones to be excluded, but only the count is provided without specific bone names. This feature might have been deprecated (2.43.0).

TexEditor.pls_select_a_file_to_preview: Please select a file to preview, open .tex or any supported image format
TexEditor.tex_tip: .tex files, accept 4 file formats, ARGB32, RGB24 data bits are PNG or JPG format, DXT5, DXT1 data bits are DDS format, if you want the highest quality, please turn on the 'Force PNG' switch, if you want the highest efficiency, please turn on the 'Compression' switch (2.43.0)
TexEditor.ImageMagick_tip: In order to support as many formats as possible, this feature requires ImageMagick to be installed and the `magick` command must be available on the system.
TexEditor.ImageMagick_tip2: After installation, execute `magick -version` in the terminal. If the execution is successful, the installation is successful. You can use it after restarting this application
TexEditor.ImageMagick_download_tip: Find the option `ImageMagick-version-Q16-HDRI-x64-dll.exe` in the download page and install it. You need to check `Add application directory to your system path` during installation. Or execute `winget install ImageMagick.Q16-HDRI` in the terminal to install it
TexEditor.force_png_tip: Force PNG: If this option is checked, no matter what format you choose, it will be forced to be converted to PNG format, including conversion to .tex and conversion to images. When converting to .tex, the data is forced to be PNG. When it is turned off, the image is converted to the suffix you choose, and when converting to .tex, it is converted to PNG or JPG according to the 'compression' switch, whether there is a transparent channel, and whether the original format is lossy compression.
TexEditor.compress_tip: Whether to compress; only valid for conversion to .tex. If checked, the image will be compressed into DDS format using DXT5 or DXT1 and stored in .tex. It is more efficient to load and saves more video memory and memory, but the disadvantage is lossy compression. When turned off, it will decide whether to convert to PNG or JPG according to the 'Force PNG' switch
TexEditor.direct_convert_tip: When enabled, when you use this application to open .tex from the resource manager, it will be directly converted to images. When you open images, they will also be directly converted to .tex. The editor interface will not be displayed (flashed). The format depends on the default format set in the editor, as well as other options.
TexEditor.export_as_image_tip: Export to image, automatically convert the format according to the suffix you choose, only the formats supported by ImageMagick, and can also be converted to .tex. If 'Force PNG' is checked, it will be converted to PNG format regardless of the suffix selected. If both the input and output are tex, copy them as is. If no suffix is ‚Äã‚Äãentered, it will be converted to PNG by default
TexEditor.export_as_tex_tip: Export to a .tex file is identical to an image, but can only select .tex suffix
TexEditor.quick_export_tip: Quick Export,Quick Export to the same file name, format depends on the default format set in the editor. Normal images are exported to .tex, and .tex to image
TexEditor.default_format_tip: Default format for quick export and direct conversion, needs to be followed by . For example .webp

AnmEditor.BonePath: The bone path, starting from the root node, is separated by slashes / to indicate which bone the following PropertyCurves apply to.
AnmEditor.PropertyIndex: Indicates which attribute of the bone the next keyframes are to be set to. 0 is LocalRotation X, 1 is LocalRotation Y, 2 is LocalRotation Z, 3 is LocalRotation W, 4 is LocalPosition X, 5 is LocalPosition Y, 6 is LocalPosition Z

SettingsPage.is_check_update_tip: Defaults to true, accessing the Github API to get the latest version information, checking once every 24 hours. If the last check failed, it will check again after 1 hour. If browser cache is cleared, this option will reset.
SettingsPage.dismiss_update_note_tip: Dismiss the update notice. If a new version is available, it will show a prompt unless manually dismissed. You need to disable the update check to prevent the prompt from appearing in the next check.
SettingsPage.file_type_strict_mode_tip: When enabled, files are identified strictly by their content. When disabled (default), files are first identified by extension, then by content if needed.

Infos.pls_select_a_file_to_preview: Please select a file to preview
Infos.pls_select_a_file_to_edit: Please select a file to edit
Infos.check_update_success_new_version_availab: Check update successfully, a new version is available, please go to the homepage to update
Infos.check_update_success_no_new_version: Check update successfully, no new version is available
Infos.file_too_large_tip: The file you are trying to open is about {{size}} MiB. Since the file density is low after deserialization to JSON, it may be hundreds of millions of lines long after conversion, and it will take several minutes to transfer to the front end. This may take up a lot of memory or directly cause the editor to crash. Do you want to continue?
Infos.file_too_large_convert_to_json_directly: You can also choose to convert directly, for example: if the input is `filename.model.json`, it will be directly converted back to `filename.model`, and vice versa, and the converted output will be sent to the original directory. After converting to .json, you can choose to edit it with other editors and then convert it back with this editor.
Infos.commands_missing_params: The key command below is missing the required parameter:
Infos.may_cause_game_malfunction: This may cause a game malfunction

Errors.pls_open_file_first_new_file_use_save_as: Please open a file first. For new files, use Save As
Errors.json_root_node_not_array: JSON root node is not an array
Errors.invalid_path_or_mate_data: Invalid file path or Mate data

autoCalcColliderError.pls_fill_file_name_first: Please fill in the collider filename first
autoCalcColliderError.read_file_filed: Failed to read corresponding col file

file_header.file_head: File Header (usually no need to modify)

PskEditor.panier_parameters_tip: Pannier, the skeleton of the skirt. In-game, 'pannier' metaphorically refers to the skirt's framework. Adjusting pannier parameters allows control over the skirt's shape and behavior.
PskEditor.panierStressForce_tip: Pannier Stress Force (PanierStressForce): The intensity of the additional force applied when pannier nodes collide with the legs. Default value: 0.4. Higher values increase the rebound force when the skirt is pushed away by the legs
PskEditor.stressDegreeMin_tip: Minimum Stress Angle (StressDegreeMin): The minimum angle threshold to trigger scaling. Default: 45 (degrees). When the bone angle exceeds this threshold, linear scaling begins. Maximum scaling is applied once the angle reaches the Maximum Stress Angle. This range reflects the degree of stress-induced deformation on the skirt fabric.
PskEditor.stressDegreeMax_tip: Maximum Stress Angle (StressDegreeMax): The maximum angle threshold for full scaling effectiveness. Default: 90 (degrees). When the bone angle exceeds the Minimum Stress Angle, linear scaling begins. Full scaling is applied at the Maximum Stress Angle. This range corresponds to the skirt fabric's deformation under stress.
PskEditor.stressMinScale_tip: Minimum Stress Scaling (StressMinScale): The scale factor applied to skirt bones at the Maximum Stress Angle, relative to their original size. Default: 0.75 (75%). For example, during intense character movement, reducing bone scale prevents clipping or excessive horizontal stretching.
PskEditor.scaleEaseSpeed_tip: Scaling Ease Speed (ScaleEaseSpeed): Controls the smoothing speed of scaling transitions. Default: 5. Lower values result in slower transitions between current and target scales.
PskEditor.panierForceDistanceThreshold_tip: Pannier Force Distance Threshold (PanierForceDistanceThreshold): The distance threshold, Default: 0.1 (meters) for activating panier forces. When panier nodes approach legs or collision nodes, physical forces gradually intensify within this range. Example: At 0.1m (10cm), effects start and strengthen as distance decreases
PskEditor.panierRadius_tip: Pannier Radius (PanierRadius): The size of individual pannier nodes. Default: 0.025 (meters). Affects collision detection range between nodes and the character/environment
PskEditor.panierRadius_order_tip: If a 'Pannier Radius Distribution Curve Group' exists, it takes priority. Otherwise, use 'Pannier Radius Distribution Curve + Pannier Radius' (final value = base value * curve value). If neither exists, use 'Pannier Radius'
PskEditor.panierRadiusDistrib_tip: Pannier Radius Distribution Curve (PanierRadiusDistrib): The distribution curve of the skirt radius controls the distribution ratio of the radius at different positions of the skirt through the curve
PskEditor.panierRadiusDistribGroups_tip: Pannier Radius Distribution Curve Group (PanierRadiusDistribGroups); you can set the value or curve for each bone individually, Unity standard curve format
PskEditor.panierForce_tip: Pannier Force (PanierForce): Base strength of physical forces in simulations. Default: 0.134. Used as a base value in formulas. If a distribution curve is applied, final value = base value * curve value
PskEditor.panierForceDistrib_tip: Pannier Force Distribution Curve (PanierForceDistrib); This allows you to convert pannier force into a curve, Unity standard curve format
PskEditor.calcTime_tip: Calculation times (CalcTime): The number of iterations of the physical simulation. The larger the value, the higher the accuracy of the physical simulation, but the greater the performance consumption. The default value is 16
PskEditor.hardValues_tip: ardness Values Array (HardValues): Bone connection strength parameters, dependent on calculation iterations. Horizontal Contraction: Resistance to lateral compression (higher values = stiffer). Default: 0. Horizontal Stretch: Constraint against lateral over-expansion. Default: 0.01. Vertical Contraction: Resistance to vertical compression. Default: 0. Vertical Stretch: Constraint to prevent excessive vertical elongation (maintains skirt length). Default: 0.7
PskEditor.velocityForceRate_tip: Velocity Inertia Retention Rate (VelocityForceRate): Controls how strongly bones retain their original velocity during movement. Default: 0.8. If a distribution curve is applied, final value = base value * curve value
PskEditor.velocityForceRateDistrib_tip: Velocity Inertia Retention Curve (VelocityForceRateDistrib): Modulates inertia retention (e.g., lower inertia at the root, higher at the skirt edge) using a Unity-standard curve format
PskEditor.gravity_tip: Gravity (Gravity): Apply an initial force on each axis to simulate gravity. The default value is 0, -0.005, 0. If there is a gravity distribution curve, this value is used as the base value. The final parameter = base value * curve value
PskEditor.gravityDistrib_tip: Gravity distribution curve (GravityDistrib); gravity distribution curve, Unity standard curve format

KeyFrameEditor.visual_editor_tip: Double-click the blank canvas to add a new key frame | Drag control points to adjust tangents | Drag key frame points to adjust position
KeyFrameEditor.keyframe_tip: Key frame (keyframe): It can turn features into curves. Unity standard keyframe format. Note that the precision is only Float32

ModelEditor.model_name_tip: The name of the model (Name), which will be set as the name of the GameObject by the game. It is often used by various plugins, such as the HighHeel plugin. The game will also check whether it is a special name
ModelEditor.root_bone_name_tip: Root Bone Name (RootBoneName), the root bone name of the model, usually the root node of the model, for example, the object bone is usually Bone_center, the body bone is usually Bip01
ModelEditor.shadow_casting_mode_tip: Shadow Casting Mode (ShadowCastingMode), only working in COM3D2.5, model version must be greater than or equal to 2104 and less than 2200, Off: turns off shadow casting, On: casts shadows, TwoSided: casts shadows on both sides, ShadowsOnly: only casts shadows
